headline.main: The Ideal and the Real of Breast-Feeding
headline.print_headline: Personal Health: The Ideal and the Real of Breast-Feeding

docs.abstract: Some dispute the message that "breast is best" and cite concerns for the pressure and guilt it heaps on working mothers.
docs.snippet: Some dispute the message that "breast is best" and cite concerns for the pressure and guilt it heaps on working mothers.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was a good day for women in Silicon Valley -- and women in business everywhere -- when Marissa Mayer, 37, became chief executive of Yahoo and announced that she is seven months pregnant. But the good news is a blip.

headline.main: Balancing Work and Life In Silicon Valley

docs.abstract: Bits blog on the hiring of Marissa Mayer as chief executive of Yahoo and its positive effects on women in Silicon Valley; notes there are still too few women engineers, start-up entrepreneurs, venture capitalists and computer science majors in the industry, but Mayer's hiring could represent a shift in attitudes. (M)
docs.snippet: It was a good day for women in Silicon Valley -- and women in business everywhere -- when Marissa Mayer, 37, became chief executive of Yahoo and announced that she is seven months pregnant.     But the good news is a blip.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the Jerusalem Film Festival, seeking insight into Israeli society in the way it presents itself on the silver screen.

headline.seo: A Correspondent’s Impressions From the Jerusalem Film Festival
headline.main: Israel, When the Lights Go Down
headline.print_headline: Israel, When the Lights Go Down

docs.abstract: Dispatch column by Jodi Rudoren describes attending the Jerusalem Film Festival in order to glean some insight into Israeli society in the way it presents itself on the silver screen.
docs.snippet: At the Jerusalem Film Festival, seeking insight into Israeli society in the way it presents itself on the silver screen.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women at the top of companies like Marissa Mayer, the new chief of Yahoo, have responsibilities that can’t be put off, but also flexibility and child-care resources that others don’t.

headline.seo: For Executive Women, Is Maternity Leave Necessary?
headline.main: Maternity Leave? It’s More Like a Pause
headline.print_headline: Maternity Leave? It’s More Like a Pause

docs.abstract: Marissa Mayer's appointment as chief of Yahoo has opened a new front in the debate over work-life balance for women; Mayer is pregnant with her first child, and her announcement that she will take only a brief maternity leave, during which she will still work, has some criticizing her for being a poor model for working women, while others congratulate her for embracing two challenges at once.
docs.snippet: Women at the top of companies like Marissa Mayer, the new chief of Yahoo, have responsibilities that can’t be put off, but also flexibility and child-care resources that others don’t.

byline.original: By ELISSA GOOTMAN and CATHERINE SAINT LOUIS
